thorwin.math.geo

Class Ray3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • thorwin.math.geo.Ray3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class Ray3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A ray consists of an origin and a direction.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Construct a ray between two points.

      • intersection

        public java.util.Optional<Vector3D> intersection(AABB box)
        Calculates the intersection point between this ray and a bounding box.
        Parameters:
        box - the box
        Returns:
        the intersection point

      • intersectionDistance

        public java.util.OptionalDouble intersectionDistance(AABB box)
        Calculates the intersection distance to an axis-aligned bounding box. Note that if the box is behind the ray a negative distance is returned. If the ray's origin is in the box, a negative distance will be returned. The negative distance is the distance to the plane of the box that would have been intersected if the ray's origin was outside the box, and the box was the right side of the ray.
        Parameters:
        box - the box
        Returns:
        the intersection distance

      • intersection

        public java.util.Optional<Vector3D> intersection(Cuboid3D cube)
        Calculates the intersection point between this ray and a cube
        Parameters:
        cube - cube
        Returns:
        the intersection point

      • intersectionDistance

        public java.util.OptionalDouble intersectionDistance(Cuboid3D cube)
        Calculates the intersection distance to a cuboid. Note that if the box is behind the ray a negative distance is returned. If the ray's origin is in the cube, a negative distance will be returned. The negative distance is the distance to the plane of the cube that would have been intersected if the ray's origin was outside the cube, and the cube was the right side of the ray.
        Parameters:
        cube - cube
        Returns:
        the intersection distance

        Returns:
        true if the ray intersects the bounding box

        public java.util.OptionalDouble intersectionDistance(Triangle3D triangle,
                                                     double epsilon)
        Calculates the intersection distance to a triangle.

        Returns:

      • intersectionDistance

        public static java.util.OptionalDouble intersectionDistance(Vector3D v1,
                                                            Vector3D v2,
                                                            Vector3D v3,
                                                            Vector3D origin,
                                                            Vector3D direction,
                                                            double epsilon)
        Calculates the intersection distance between this ray and a triangle using the algorithm by Thomas Moller.
        Parameters:
        v1 - triangle vertex 1
        v2 - triangle vertex 2
        v3 - triangle vertex 3
        origin - ray origin
        direction - ray direction
        epsilon - epsilon value to determine if ray is in triangle plane
        Returns:
        the intersection distance
